paragraphs: On Saturday, March 26, the star of the Ukrainian culinary show "Master Chef," Olga Martynovska, will once again prepare borscht and other delicious dishes of Ukrainian cuisine for the residents of Prague. You can try them at the traditional farmers' market at Naplavka (Rašínovo nábřeží) from 08:00 to 14:00.
Guests will find treats in the tent "NEJSI SÁM" with Ukrainian symbolism.
On the menu: borscht with dumplings, lard, cherry pies, poppy seed pies, pancakes, other pastries, and kissel.
This is a charity event. All the money collected will go towards purchasing medicine for the residents of Ukraine.

The famous chef olga_martynovska was forced to leave Kyiv after the Russian invasion. Together with her 6-year-old daughter, she found herself in Prague, where she launched the project NEJSI SÁM ("You are not alone") to raise funds for Ukrainians affected by the war.
